ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I had gained a better understanding of Vietnamese and the grammar style of the language. I had some understanding of the language but it has definitely improved because of this class.

With zero prior knowledge of Vietnamese, despite my heritage, Viet 110 with Professor Quang taught me far more in one semester than I could've ever imagined. Not only do I have a basic understanding of reading and writing that goes far beyond the elementary level, but I also have a decent grasp of conversational Vietnamese. In addition to this, Thay Quang brings you a little closer to Vietnamese culture in his lessons on Tet and other holidays. Anyone who is interested in Vietnamese should take this course!
Learned Vietnamese
This course was a fantastic introduction to everyday phrases used by Vietnamese speakers with plenty of opportunities to improve speaking, listening, and writing skills.
basic vietnamese
I learned to read, write, and speak comfortably. Although I had some difficulties at first, the assistance and tutoring that was provided helped me to improve.
I learned how to read and write Vietnamese

Basic Vietnamese grammar, vocab, pronunciation, reading, writing, speaking, listening
Learned a little about Vietnamese culture but because a lot of the class is heritage students, this was not a big focus of the content

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was a fun class that had various activities to do and they were all helpful

This class is very straightforward with expectations and fairly simple to keep up with. Professor Quang is a great communicator and I'd say that contributes to the majority of his strengths. The only weakness I'd say this course has is a heavy reliance on large packets of work (17 pages at least) that are due weekly. They're pretty manageable, but maybe not for those who are taking an introductory language course with a really heavy workload.
Great interactive class

The instructors fostered a highly collaborative and fun space for learning, making the classroom a very inviting space for trying new skills. Professor Van and TA Nguyen cared deeply for the students growth in the language.
It was hard to figure out exactly what homework assignments were required. A more organized week calendar would be better. The professor was very engaging and funny. I learned a lot in this course.

Strengths: Many of the assignments and projects are done with partners which establishes deep connections with classmates and the class overall. This developed a strong community in the class and made learning Vietnamese fun, enjoyable, and less difficult. 

Weaknesses: A bit unorganized. Some assignments contribute to your grade and some dont. Deadlines are unclear at times and some units felt rushed.
I like how flexible the course is and how interactive it is

Strengths: instructors were very nice and willing to help
great class community and environment

weaknesses: very very unstructured and severe lack of planning 
us students were often (basically every week) confused about what homework was due, especially projects
class schedules could often be confusing about the actual due date of assignments, and they were infrequently released on Canvas (sometimes only given out in class and not made available to students who missed class that day)
several times, there would be a quiz or test on the schedule which, when we showed up on class, was abruptly changed to take-home format
homework assignments were often repetitive and impossible to do without using outside resources (they included material that wasn't contained in the textbook or covered in class)
after homework submission was moved to Canvas, we stopped receiving feedback and grades on homework assignments

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, even for non-native speakers, the teacher creates an environment where all the students work together so it's fun learning with one another

I would highly recommend this course! (I've been recommending it to anyone who hasn't started their language credits). Not only does this course allow you an understanding of Vietnamese far beyond the elementary level, Professor Quang teaches it at a pace that is easy to keep up with and interactive. Professor Quang has a very fun teaching style and is very easy to learn from. Anyone with a slight interest in the Vietnamese language or culture or even someone who simply wants to learn a new language should consider taking Thay Quang's Viet 110 course!!
Super nice professor

Yes, I would highly recommend this course to other students! The course is fun, engaging, and moves at a pace that is not overwhelming but helps students immensely improve their Vietnamese language skills.
Yes, learn a lot and gain access to the vietnamese community
I would definitely recommend this class. Instructor and TA were both helpful and kind.

yes, but with extreme reservations

if you're not a heritage student with a decent background in Vietnamese already, you should be prepared to do a lot of self-studying and/or consulting online resources and/or asking Vietnamese friends and/or tutoring and/or going to office hours outside of class, because the class isn't very organized, which makes it especially difficult for those starting from "0" with Vietnamese.

however, the instructors are very nice and kind, and the class community was strongalthough partially because we felt united in our confusion about when homework assignments were due, what was going on in class, etc.
